text_en: The cane is an extension of the arm and the index finger has to point down on the cane. A person with visual impairment (PWVI) will then be aware of different surfaces and obstacles.

Let the angle of the cane be around 45 degrees toward the surface. The main techniques are constant contact, and touch technique. When using constant contact the cane has contact with the surface all the time and swings from side to side. This technique allows the the person with visual impairment to be aware of obstacles in front of her/him before she/he reaches them.

Use trail technique when walking along a house. Let the cane follow the wall. Use the thumb to support the cane. Then the person with visual impairment knows when she/he has reached the end of the house.
When going up or down stairs, handle the cane vertically. The person with visual impairment should have the cane in front of her/him and measure the height of the next step.
Find the door handle? Hold the cane vertically and move it horisontally. Then The person with visual impairment will find the door handle with ease.
